vote.title: To authorize the Board of Health to enter into a revenue contract with the City of Worthington for the provision of public health services, and to authorize the receipt of revenues into the 2024 Health Special Revenue Fund.  ($85,084.00)
vote.description:
Explanation                                          
 
BACKGROUND:  Section 3709.08 of the Ohio Revised Code permits a city constituting a city health district to enter into a contract with another city constituting a city health district to provide public health services for its citizens. The City of Worthington has elected to enter into a contract with Columbus Public Health to provide its citizens with public health services in an amount not to exceed $85,084.00 for the period of January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024. Under the contract, the City of Worthington reimburses Columbus Public Health for all direct and indirect costs incurred.
 
FISCAL IMPACT:  Expenditures and revenues to provide these services are budgeted in the 2024 Health Special Revenue Fund, Fund No. 2250. ($85,084.00)
 
Title
 
To authorize the Board of Health to enter into a revenue contract with the City of Worthington for the provision of public health services, and to authorize the receipt of revenues into the 2024 Health Special Revenue Fund.  ($85,084.00)
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, Section 3709.08 of the Ohio Revised Code permits a city constituting a city health district to enter into a contract with another city constituting a city health district to provide public health services for its citizens; and,
 
WHEREAS, the City of Worthington has a need to enter into a contract with the City of Columbus to provide various public health services for its citizens in an amount not to exceed $85,084.00 for the period of January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024; and,
 
WHEREAS, Columbus Public Health has the expertise and resources required to carry out those services; and, 
 
WHEREAS, it has become necessary in the usual daily operation of the Board of Health to authorize Columbus Public Health to enter into a contract with the City of Worthington for public health services;  NOW THEREFORE
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
SECTION 1. That the Board of Health is hereby authorized to enter into a revenue contract with the City of Worthington for the provision of various public health services in an amount not to exceed $85,084.00 for the period of January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024.
 
SECTION 2. That the City Auditor is authorized to make any accounting changes necessary to ensure that revenues from this contract are properly accounted for and recorded accurately on the city's financial records.
 
SECTION 3. That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
